ai.summary: Clarendon Way is a long-distance trail in the UK. The route covers 123.5 km and is rated hard, traversing varied rural landscapes. It’s best tackled as a multi-day trek by experienced hikers who are prepared for changing weather and challenging terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail features mixed terrain: chalk downs, farmland, hedgerows, woodlands, and occasional country lanes and minor roads. Expect undulating sections, some steep ascents, and uneven, muddy surfaces especially after rain. Navigation is generally straightforward but be prepared for rural waymarks and occasional junctions.
ai.safety_notes: Plan your trip in advance with a detailed map or GPS, check the forecast and daylight hours, and inform someone of your itinerary. Carry adequate food and water, multiple navigation tools, and a fully charged phone. Wear sturdy boots, be prepared for mud and weather changes, and watch for road crossings and livestock gates. In poor conditions, consider shorter day legs or seeking shelter and help if needed.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Layered clothing and a waterproof, windproof jacket
Waterproof pants and a breathable mid-layer
Map and compass or a GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Water bottle and/or hydration system (plan for 2–3 liters per day)
High-energy snacks and meals for multi-day trekking
First aid kit and blister care supplies
Mobile phone with portable charger and offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March to October)

seo.title: Clarendon Way Hike Guide – UK 123.5 km Hard Trail
seo.meta_description: Plan your expedition on the Clarendon Way in the UK. A 123.5 km hard-distance hike with varied terrain, safety tips, gear needs, and best seasons.
